comments.text:
On current Nightly (hg 161c6106d787), running on a Nexus S.

http://dromaeo.com/?recommended

Gets a content process crash in the DOM tests.
comments.author: gpascutto@mozilla.com

comments.text: Still happens on current Fennec Native nightly. This might be a memory/OOM issue.
comments.raw_text: Still happens on current Fennec Native nightly. This might be a memory/OOM issue.

comments.text:
Created attachment 602299
Logfile of crash.

The logfile shows a lot of apps dieing one by one, until Fennec exits without an Exception. Thats why I think this is an OOM.

The Nexus S has about 330M of app memory, of which about 180M is usable by Fennec.
comments.author: gpascutto@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:

comments.creator: gpascutto@mozilla.com
bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.text:
Depending on GC heuristics, I can definitely see this happen.  The Dromaeo test does a lot of pretty memory-intensive stuff (things like creating tens of thousands of 2KB strings for example, if we don't GC expeditiously enough).

Can you try running the DOM tests one by one to see whether a particular one is crashing for you?
comments.raw_text:

Can you try running the DOM tests one by one to see whether a particular one is crashing for you?

comments.creator: gpascutto@mozilla.com
comments.author: gpascutto@mozilla.com
comments.text: It crashed at Rotating 3D Cube. But if I run only that test, it survives.
comments.raw_text: It crashed at Rotating 3D Cube. But if I run only that test, it survives.

comments.text:
3d-cube is a pure JS benchmark, no?

It really does sound like we're just not GCin expeditiously enough and ending up OOM.
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text:
3d-cube is a pure JS benchmark, no?

It really does sound like we're just not GCin expeditiously enough and ending up OOM.
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.text:
Yes, no rendering is done.

I started just the 6 tests (Dromaeo JavaScript tests), and quickly switched to task manager. I saw Nightly at 150M RAM usage and it crashed shortly after.

For what its worth, I tried Chrome Beta on the same "recommended" set and it went "Aww snap!" 

Maybe the benchmark just requires more RAM than this device has (which is scary - it's not *that* low end).
comments.author: gpascutto@mozilla.com
comments.creator: gpascutto@mozilla.com

>Maybe the benchmark just requires more RAM than this device has

Err, that's obviously not the case as running it individually works. But there clearly isn't much wiggle room here.
